radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the right lower limb
radiographic_examinations.findings: Cerebriform connective tissue overgrowth or nevus identified on both the plantar and lateral aspects of the right foot, right foot enlarged in size, visible length and size discrepancy between the right and left legs, muscle atrophy in the thigh, hypertrophy of intermuscular and subcutaneous fat planes, hypertrophy of subcutaneous fat and fatty infiltration in calf muscles, both fibulas displayed inward bowing.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Right lower limb contrast-enhanced angiography and venography
radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlargement in the right superficial femoral, popliteal, and posterior tibial arteries; feeders from the posterior tibial artery in the lower third of the leg; prominent vascular channels on the posterolateral aspect of the right leg and foot; abnormal vessels within the foot; dilation in the lower third of the superficial femoral and popliteal veins; prominent long saphenous vein; multiple varicosities along the anterior and lateral aspects of the thigh and leg.
